text: What is the correct way to do this - can’t seem to find anything in the documentation.
`data.e_image.src` should be `data.src`
Wait nevermind, misread
Sorry I could be more clear too. e_data is the group. e_image is the image field inside the group.
Assuming your group is called `e_data` and the image in that group is called `e_image`, that looks correct
Is there a default value for the image?
Yes there is
Is your code actually using the fancy quotation marks (`“` as opposed to `"`), or is that just an artifact of pasting?
Interesting, I just pasted it - so I’m not sure.
When I load the preview it shows me <img src(unknown)> ==$0
Could just be that
Hi <@U2H3TT8F2> wondering if you could still help me out with this?
:slightly_smiling_face:
that should override the default link color that is being used in the template
naturally you would swap out `#fff` with whatever hex color you wanted
I see, added the code and it still gives me the blue
<https://e.bettertogether.tv/welcome?hs_preview=xdYVpYVm-7883947202>
the module is at the bottom of the page
with the social icons
can you post (or DM) a screenshot of the custom module interface? It's hard to fully diagnose the problem without being in the backend of the site.
meaning what you are seeing in the design manager
ah I am sering an issue, you added the CSS to your class attribute on the element. You need to add this into the CSS pane that is in the custom module editor
it would be the area outlined in red below
Got it!
i added it to the top of the CSS pane, and still no luck. Should i remove the rest of the coding?
you're missing the period in front of social-icons
should be `.social-icons a {color:#fff;}`
I would recommend reading some guides on using CSS to better understand CSS markup and how it works. A good source for this is here: <https://css-tricks.com/guides/beginner/>
Great, thank you
